title: Abdulkadir Canatar
text:
I am a Flatiron Research Fellow in the NeuroAI and Geometric Data Analysis Lab led by SueYeon Chung at Flatiron Institute’s Center for Computational Neuroscience. I received my PhD in Physics in 2022 from Harvard University, where I worked on deep learning theory under the supervision of Cengiz Pehlevan. Before that, I earned my M.Sc. in Physics and B.Sc. in Electronics Engineering from Sabancı University.

Current Research
My research lies at the intersection of neuroscience, machine learning, and physics, with a focus on understanding how the brain processes and represents natural stimuli. I develop theoretical frameworks and computational models to study neural representations of sensory inputs. I apply tools from statistical mechanics, random matrix theory, and deep learning to uncover the principles underlying neural computation and perception.
I am particularly interested in:

Neural representation of natural stimuli and their geometric structure
Information processing in biological and artificial neural networks
Development of robust tools for describing representational geometry
Statistical physics of learning and neural computation

title: Publications
text:
Below is a generated list from my BibTeX.







References

Bordelon, Blake, Abdulkadir Canatar, and Cengiz Pehlevan. 2020. “Spectrum Dependent Learning Curves in Kernel Regression and Wide Neural Networks.” In Proceedings of the 37th International Conference on Machine Learning, 1024–34.


Canatar, Abdulkadir. 2022. “Statistical Mechanics of Generalization in Kernel Regression and Wide Neural Networks.” PhD thesis, Harvard University.


Canatar, Abdulkadir, Blake Bordelon, and Cengiz Pehlevan. 2021a. “Out-of-Distribution Generalization in Kernel Regression.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 34: 12600–12612.


———. 2021b. “Spectral Bias and Task-Model Alignment Explain Generalization in Kernel Regression and Infinitely Wide Neural Networks.” Nature Communications 12 (1): 1–12.


Canatar, Abdulkadir, and SueYeon Chung. 2025. “Statistical Mechanics of Support Vector Regression.” Physical Review E 112 (2): 025301.


Canatar, Abdulkadir, and Cengiz Pehlevan. 2022. “A Kernel Analysis of Feature Learning in Deep Neural Networks.” In 2022 58th Annual Allerton Conference on Communication, Control, and Computing (Allerton), 1–8. IEEE.


Canatar, Abdulkadir, Evan Peters, Cengiz Pehlevan, Stefan M Wild, and Ruslan Shaydulin. 2022. “Bandwidth Enables Generalization in Quantum Kernel Models.” Transactions on Machine Learning Research.


Canatar*, Abdulkadir, Jenelle Feather*, Albert Wakhloo, and SueYeon Chung. 2024. “A Spectral Theory of Neural Prediction and Alignment.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 36.


Chun*, Chanwoo, Abdulkadir Canatar*, SueYeon Chung, and Daniel Lee. 2025a. “Estimating Dimensionality of Neural Representations from Finite Samples.” arXiv Preprint arXiv:2509.26560.


———. 2025b. “Estimating Neural Representation Alignment from Sparsely Sampled Inputs and Features.” In 8th Annual Conference on Cognitive Computational Neuroscience. https://openreview.net/forum?id=J5gRYqAXnv.


Kang*, Hyunmo, Abdulkadir Canatar*, and SueYeon Chung. 2025. “Spectral Analysis of Representational Similarity with Limited Neurons.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems [In press].


Zavatone-Veth, Jacob A, Abdulkadir Canatar, Benjamin S Ruben, and Cengiz Pehlevan. 2022. “Asymptotics of Representation Learning in Finite Bayesian Neural Networks.” Journal of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment 2022 (11): 114008. http://dx.doi.org/10.1088/1742-5468/ac98a6.


Zavatone-Veth, Jacob, Abdulkadir Canatar, Ben Ruben, and Cengiz Pehlevan. 2021. “Asymptotics of Representation Learning in Finite Bayesian Neural Networks.” Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 34: 24765–77.
